sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lea Verou)
articles.description: The annual survey for anyone who writes CSS, [State of CSS](https://stateofcss.com/), is nearing the end of its response period for 2022. The survey is available in many different languages while all questions are optional, i.e. reaching 100% completion is not required. Please do make sure to [join in](https://stateofcss.com/) — it will only take a few minutes.
articles.title: State Of CSS Survey: Influence The Future Of CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sacha Greif)
articles.description: In this article, Sacha Greif tries to anticipate future CSS trends and takes a look at some far-fetched and futuristic CSS features that might one day make their way to the browser.
articles.title: Futuristic CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: In this article, Patrick Brosset gives an update on the most impactful new features that are now available in DevTools, across Firefox, Chrome, Safari, and Edge.
articles.title: What’s New In DevTools: Halloween Edition 🎃

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Meet Understanding Privacy, our brand new Smashing Book to make sense of privacy, and learn how to create inclusive, safe and privacy-aware digital experiences. eBook now available, print shipping in November.
articles.title: Understanding Privacy: A New Smashing Book Is Here

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Schäferhoff)
articles.description: In this article, Nick Schäferhoff will take a deep dive into WordPress Full-Site Editing, examine the tools it provides for theme development, and provide a tutorial on how to use it to make changes to your site.
articles.title: WordPress Full-Site Editing: A Deep Dive Into The New Feature

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrii Zhdan)
articles.description: In this article about conducting productive meetings, Andrii Zhdan will give you a step-by-step guide on preparing a solid meeting structure that will let you follow the original plan and reach the meeting goals, and he will also share a few tips based on his design experience.
articles.title: Effective Communication For Everyday Meetings

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: Climate change and sustainability are increasing concerns for digital organizations, as well as individuals working in tech. In this article, we’ll explore some of the ways we can raise awareness and effect change within an organization to create a more positive environmental impact.
articles.title: Sustainable Web Development Strategies Within An Organization

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this article, Adrian Bece will show how to create same-document page transitions for Single Page Apps using Shared Element Transitions API and check out its future implementation and potential for creating cross-document transitions in Multi-Page Apps.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Devansh Bansal)
articles.description: Owing to tremendous advancements in Machine Learning and other technologies, chatbots have increased in popularity in the past few years. This article will show you, step by step, how to build a chatbot that meets your business goals.
articles.title: A Roadmap For Building A Business Chatbot

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexander Godwin)
articles.description: Integrate two-factor authentication into your Express.js app by building an application that authenticates users using password-based authentication and OTPs powered by the Twilio Verify service.
articles.title: Node.js Authentication With Twilio Verify

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Brecht De Ruyte)
articles.description: We can use the `clamp()` method today because of the great browser support. In this article, Brecht De Ruyte explains how it can be a beautiful addition to your upcoming project or as an upgrade to a previous one.
articles.title: Easy Fluid Typography With clamp() Using Sass Functions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: Shared Element Transitions API is a game-changing feature that will enable us to create impressive and elaborate UI animations easily. In this article, Adrian Bece will explore its incredible potential by building four real-life examples from scratch.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: How about a little inspiration boost? Well, we might have something for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe. They are available in versions with and without a calendar for October and can be downloaded for free. Enjoy!
articles.title: October Vibes For Your Desktop (2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Trina Moore Pervall)
articles.description: Throughout the research and design processes, our unconscious biases are the greatest risk to delivering inclusive experiences. From who we include and exclude in our research to how we plan and conduct research, it’s crucial that we understand how our unacknowledged biases can perpetuate systems of exclusion.
articles.title: Unconscious Biases That Get In The Way Of Inclusive Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Wix Security Team)
articles.description: In this article, Wix security experts share ten “security by design” principles that emerged from their work in keeping the Wix platform secure. If you’re a developer, these tried-and-true principles can help you build your own secure applications.
articles.title: Building Your Security Strategy (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Onno Westra)
articles.description: The customer journey is not limited to a website alone. Simply by combining the world of website design and telephony, far better results can be obtained for your organization. And thanks to the similarities and mutual benefits, it is an easy step to take.
articles.title: Phone Numbers For Web Designers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Agustinus Theodorus)
articles.description: You don’t need a framework for everything, but if you use one, this article will help you use it in the most performant way.
articles.title: Five Data-Loading Patterns To Boost Web Performance

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: SmashingConf NYC is back! A friendly, inclusive conference for designers and front-end engineers who can’t wait to learn and be inspired. October 10–13, 2022. Get your ticket!
articles.title: Meet SmashingConf New York 🇺🇸 (Oct 10–13)

articles.author: Valentine Gatwiri
articles.description: Contributing to open source can be a daunting prospect, especially if you haven't done so before, or if you're used to working on documentation rather than code. This guide will help technical writers get started contributing to open-source projects, and outline some of the common pitfalls you might encounter when
articles.title: How to Contribute to Open Source – a Guide for Technical Writers

articles.author: Flavio Copes
articles.description: Introduction to Swift The Swift programming language was created by Apple in 2014. It's the official language that works with the whole Apple Operating Systems lineup: iOS, iPadOS, watchOS, macOS, and tvOS. Swift is an open source, general purpose, compiled programming language that's statically typed. Every value has a type
articles.title: The Swift Handbook – Learn Swift for Beginners

articles.author: Joel Olawanle
articles.description: Structured Query Language (SQL) is a programming language that you use to manage data in relational databases. You can use SQL to create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) data in a relational database. You can write SQL queries to insert data with INSERT, read data with SELECT, update with UPDATE,
articles.title: SQL Select – Statement and Query Examples

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Web Monetization means that you can get money for every person that visits your website. Sounds good right? But how does it work?  We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to monetize your website using microtransactions and the Interledger Protocol.
articles.title: How to Monetize Your Website with Microtransactions

articles.author: Edeh Israel Chidera
articles.description: Firebase provides some great services like NoSQL databases, authentication, cloud storage, and much more. In this tutorial, we will learn how to use your React application to read and add data to your Firebase database.  To demonstrate this, we will learn how to build a Todo app using React
articles.title: How to Use Cloud Firestore in a React App

articles.author: Salim Oyinlola
articles.description: What is the Gradient Descent Algorithm? Gradient descent is probably the most popular machine learning algorithm. At its core, the algorithm exists to minimize errors as much as possible.  The aim of gradient descent as an algorithm is to minimize the cost function of a model. We can tell
articles.title: Gradient Descent – Machine Learning Algorithm Example

articles.author: Destiny Erhabor
articles.description: Images and videos are examples of huge files that might be stored in your database. And this might impact the performance of your applications because of the amount of space that those files can take up.  Also, it expands the database, which makes backups larger and slower. Because of
articles.title: How to Upload Files to Azure using NestJS and typeORM with MySQL

articles.author: Ophy Boamah
articles.description: Your web layout is to your website what a floor plan is to a building. Without them, you’re just building castles in the air.  The first thing to do when you have a website or application to build or design is to decide on the layout. This is important
articles.title: Web Layouts – How to Use CSS Grid and Flex to Create a Responsive Web Page

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: Object Relational Mapping (ORM) is a technique used in creating a "bridge" between object-oriented programs and, in most cases, relational databases [/news/what-is-a-relational-database-rdbms-definition/]. Put another way, you can see the ORM as the layer that connects object oriented programming [/news/four-pillars-of-object-oriented-programming/] (OOP) to relational databases.  When interacting with a database using
articles.title: What is an ORM – The Meaning of Object Relational Mapping Database Tools

articles.author: Omer Rosenbaum
articles.description: Whether you’ve been aware of it or not, you’ve probably used the Ethernet in the past. Does this cable look familiar? (Source: Wikipedia [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethernet_physical_layer#/media/File:EthernetCableYellow3.jpg] )Ethernet is extremely popular, and is the most widely used Data Link Layer protocol, at least where the devices are linked by physical cables (rather than
articles.title: How the Ethernet Protocol Works – A Complete Guide
